instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]Why do some 2390/2610 boards have the heat pipe sensor, and other don't?
threads.message:
I've noticed it seems to be pretty random which boards have the heatsink with the heat pipe sensor in place, while they all have the connector for it. Does it matter if that sensor is present? If I have 10 boards that all came in with no heatsinks, and I have no clue which ones originally DID have the heatsink with the sensor attached, is it necessary to find out which ones had it? Or can I just install heatsinks without the sensor on all of them and call it a day? I don't do much work on these older boards, so haven't come across the issue much.

Any help appreciated.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Why do some 2390/2610 boards have the heat pipe sensor, and other don't?
[SOLVED]Why do some 2390/2610 boards have the heat pipe sensor, and other don't?
